meanings.definition: A unit of data equal to 1 billion bits.
meanings.sent1: I downloaded a movie that was over two gigabits in size.
meanings.sent2: The internet speed of one gigabits per second is incredibly fast.
meanings.sent3: My computer must have eaten too many gigabits; it's running so slow!
meanings.sent4: Her brain was like a storage device filled with gigabits of memories.
meanings.sent5: The gigabits of information flooded his mind, overwhelming him.

meanings.sent1: The office upgraded to gigabits for faster internet.
meanings.sent2: I wish my home network had gigabits for smoother streaming.
meanings.sent3: The gigabits in the cables were having a party, making the connection lightning-fast.
meanings.sent4: Their communication was like gigabits flowing seamlessly between them.
meanings.sent5: The gigabits linked everyone together, creating a web of connectivity.

meanings.definition: The capacity of a storage device measured in gigabits.
meanings.sent1: The new hard drive has a capacity of 500 gigabits.
meanings.sent2: I need a storage device with more gigabits to save all my photos.
meanings.sent3: The gigabits in the memory card whispered secrets to each other.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a storage device filled with gigabits of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The gigabits in the cloud stored memories of a lifetime.
